summary: Captain Marvel: A New Dawn of Heroes
title: Captain Marvel: A New Dawn of Heroes
body:
(Link to the full Essay is at the bottom )

Captain Marvel is set to premiere in one month at the time of writing this. Now I’ve heard a lot of things, both good and bad, and I want to break those down with facts. Before I we go forward, however, let’s go back. Back to the time of the golden age of horror films. That’s the 70’s and 80’s for anyone curious. Now I know what your’e thinking, but just stick with me.

The Horror genre was booming, and out from these movies came a legendary trope: The Final Girl. It was a simple idea: Have the final survivor of your movie be a woman. Characters like Ripley from Alien, Laurie from Halloween, Sally from the Texas Chainsaw Massacre, and Nancy from Nightmare on Elm Street. To this day, its a trope still held by most Horror movies. But you’re asking yourself, “What does that have to do with Captain Marvel?” Well, it’s very simple: We, as a society, love badass females.

Whether they’re fighting aliens like Ripley, slicing off heads like Beatrix Kiddo, or reading books to help your friends like Hermoine, men and women alike LOVE badass females. Women aspire to be them, and men aspire to be with them. But now you’re asking, “Well, I think we like badasses, regardless of gender.”

That might be true, but that’s my point. It doesn’t matter if you’re a man, or a woman, being a badass is a trait we all love… But therein lies the problem. There isn’t an equal playing field between the two genders. Now if you lined up all the badass action heroes on one side, and all the female action heroes on the other… well, equality is not a word you’d use to describe what you see.

“But it doesn’t matter what gender they are!” Except… It does, just maybe not to you. We all like seeing ourselves portrayed on television and film. “But I liked the Ninja Turtles!” And my point is proven. We all like seeing ourselves, be it through looks OR personality. For some, seeing someone act like ourselves is enough to sate them. For others, its looks.

Think about this: Why are Batman, Spider-Man, and Superman the three premiere superheroes? Because of their actions and the symbols they wear. Batman is a regular guy, and yet he is constantly put on the same pedestal as Superman; a god among men. Why? It’s not money, but his smarts. He’s a damaged individual who prefers to be alone, but no matter what, he never gives up. He doesn’t kill, and his symbol of the Bat might as well be lady justice herself. We’ve all felt alone, and Batman is there to show us its alright to feel that way sometimes. We’ve all felt weak, but Batman shows us strength of the mind is just as powerful, if not more, than the strength of the body.

For fans of Superman? Its simple. His symbol means Strength. You someone wear a Superman symbol and you know they value power: whether physical or mental or emotional. People look to Superman’s emblem and are instantly inspired, because they know that Superman is the strongest there is, and it’s his strength that gives them strength.

For Spider-man… Well, I’ll let Stan the Man explain it. “Most people aren’t perfect. You and I aren’t perfect. Poor Spider-Man, sure he’s good at catching bad guys, but he’s apt to get an allergy attack while he’s doing it. He’ll have dandruff, an ingrown toenail, he’ll tear his costume, his aunt may won’t let him go out to save the day- He’s real.”

Superheroes have taught us that anyone can be a hero, because all you need to do to be a hero is do the right thing. That’s all Spider-Man, Batman, Superman, and any hero has ever done: Do the right thing.

Now let me put those three puzzle pieces together. We have Female bad asses, what we relate to, and symbols of inspiration. Now let’s take all those pieces and make something with them. Let’s create a female bad ass, one who fights aliens, and doesn’t take crap from anyone. Let’s piece it together with relatability. Let’s make the female bad ass a hard worker, who has flaws just like you and I. Someone who’s not perfect, who makes mistakes, but who we love because they always do the right thing. Someone who both women and men can relate to. Someone who has a symbol that means something… Let’s say it’s a star with red and blue stripes, and let’s say it means Higher, Further, Faster. Let’s say this symbol tells everyone who wears it that this person believes in going higher, further, and faster than ever have before. Now let’s put all those things together and what do you get? Well, I’d like to think that’s obvious. You get Captain Marvel.

If you want to read the rest of my essay, please follow the link. http://feytalebook.com/home/blogs/captain-marvel-a-new-dawn-of-heroes/

summary: I need to stop watching all the new Captain Marvel TV spots because they keep putting new stuff in them and like YES THEY ARE...
body: I need to stop watching all the new Captain Marvel TV spots because they keep putting new stuff in them and like YES THEY ARE AMAZING but at a certain point I wanna be surprised by most of it. That being said, the newest one where the Skrull roars in her face and she screams back and then knocks it across the corridor is EPIC and 100% comic Carol Danvers approved.

summary: In 2013, I made a Captain Marvel print for HeroesCon. I was so happy with it that I offered it free to Captain Marvel fans. Six...
caption:
In 2013, I made a Captain Marvel print for HeroesCon. I was so happy with it that I offered it free to Captain Marvel fans. Six years ago, that was. My art got a little better since then. Also, I wrote about my favorite Carol issue, X-Men 158, here on Tumblr.

I knew I wanted to take advantage of the winter downtime between convention seasons to make a new Captain Marvel print, and here are the stages of it.

I made a 4 x 5 sketch, scanned it, and enlarged it for an 11 x 17 board. I printed it, lightboxed it, and fleshed out the pencils based on posters and screen captures from the trailers. Then I lightboxed the pencils on another board for the inks, and somehow it came out all Walt Simonson-y. I didn’t notice until after I scanned it that I don’t have any black masses. It’s all lines.

After coloring it, I found some YouTube videos for making speedlines and then recreated a photo of the earth with simple Photoshop brush settings. Nothing too detailed, because I knew it was going to be blurred. I made the starfield in Illustrator by making three sizes of white circles scattered by the symbols sprayer.

I have this print in letter and tabloid sizes to sell at conventions this year – SC Comicon, NC Comicon, HeroesCon, any others I can get into – and they’re also for sale on my new online store, Robot Wonderboy.

Just one month til the movie, people!

I made a 4 x 5 sketch, scanned it, and enlarged it for an 11 x 17 board. I printed it, lightboxed it, and fleshed out the pencils based on posters and screen captures from the trailers. Then I lightboxed the pencils on another board for the inks, and somehow it came out all Walt Simonson-y. I didn’t notice until after I scanned it that I don’t have any black masses. It’s all lines.

After coloring it, I found some YouTube videos for making speedlines and then recreated a photo of the earth with simple Photoshop brush settings. Nothing too detailed, because I knew it was going to be blurred. I made the starfield in Illustrator by making three sizes of white circles scattered by the symbols sprayer.

I have this print in letter and tabloid sizes to sell at conventions this year – SC Comicon, NC Comicon, HeroesCon, any others I can get into – and they’re also for sale on my new online store, Robot Wonderboy.

Just one month til the movie, people!

summary: Hear Carol Danvers' Primal War Cry in This New Captain Marvel TV Spot
title: Hear Carol Danvers' Primal War Cry in This New Captain Marvel TV Spot
excerpt: Though she’s destined to become the galaxy’s mightiest hero, Captain Marvel’s Carol Danvers will always be a warrior at heart, thanks to unique Kree conditioning that left her physically empowered and mentally conditioned to be a lethal fighter. The latest TV spot for the film just gives us a small taste of what that means.
